Package DataAccess

Class AbstractDAO<T>

java.lang.Object
DataAccess.AbstractDAO<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientDAO, OrdersDAO, ProductDAO
public class AbstractDAO<T> extends Object
The class prepares queries for the statements and methods to run them as well. It is an abstract class which can later on be used by all the types of tables. It also uses reflection in order to get the contents of the table

  • Method Details

    • getColumnsNumber

      public int getColumnsNumber()
      returns the number of columns of the table

    • createSelectQuery

      private String createSelectQuery(String field)
      The method creates the select query, with "?", that will later on be replaced by variables

    • createSelectAllQuery

      private String createSelectAllQuery()
      The method creates the select all query, with "?", that will later on be replaced by variables

    • createInsertQuery

      private String createInsertQuery()
      The method creates the insert query, with "?", that will later on be replaced by variables

    • createUpdateQuery

      private String createUpdateQuery()
      The method creates the update query, with "?", that will later on be replaced by variables

    • createDeleteQuery

      private String createDeleteQuery(String condition)
      The method creates the delete query, with "?", that will later on be replaced by variables

    • findAll

      public List<T> findAll()
      The method returns the contents of the table as a List of T type. It uses the select all query in order to get all the data

    • findById

      public T findById(int id)
      The method returns the instance of the table which has the desired id. The method uses the select query, which uses as a condition the id field

    • createObjects

      private List<T> createObjects(ResultSet resultSet)
      The method returns a list of type T, having been given a resultSet. In order to do that, it uses reflection.

    • insert

      public T insert(T instance)
      The method inserts a new instance in the table, making use of the insert query previously defined

    • update

      public T update(T instance, int id)
      The method updates the instance with the given id with the other values from the given instances. To achieve that, it uses the update query statement, with the id pasted as the condition.

    • delete

      public T delete(T instance, String condition)
      The method deletes the instances passed as a parameter, using the delete query

    • getColumns

      public String[] getColumns()
      The method return the header of the columns as an array of type String in order to use it when declaring a JTable

    • getData

      public String[][] getData()
      The method return the data of the table as a matrix of type String in order to use it when declaring a JTable
